It may be used freely by individuals for research, teaching, and personal use as long as this statement of availability is included in the text. For all other use contact the Tennessee State Library and Archives, 403 Seventh Avenue North, Nashville, TN 37243-0312. (615) 741-2764.

bibl.title: [Entries from the Cherokee Supreme Court Docket, 1823-1834, New Echota] 1830 Oct. 21
bibl.note: This is an excerpt from the Cherokee Supreme Court docket for the years 1823 to 1834. The Cherokee Supreme Court convened annually in New Echota beginning on the second Monday in October and lasting three weeks. This excerpt is from the October 21, 1830 session of court, during which two civil cases were heard, one of which involved the selling of an "unsound" slave. Entries from this Supreme Court docket cover items ch100-ch163.

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 2.1 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

div.head: Thursday 21st
div.p:
The Court met according to adjournment Preasent Present as yesterday, W. S. Adair, Andrew Ross and
Jno John Huss Judges

p.del:
John McCarvy
&
M. Gore by their agent McConnel
vs
John Martin
The court find for the plaintiff nineteen dollars forty four cents and a half. this was an action

div.p:
John McCarver & Maurice Gore by their agent
Saml. Samuel McConnel
vs
John Martin

This was an action brought on a note of hand executed about the first day of January 1830 and due the first of march following, the sum of three hundred and fifty dollars by John Martin to the above McCarver and Gore, and it appearing to sattissfaction satisfaction of the court that the said note was given in part of the consideration of three negroes and it also appearing that a negro woman one of the three was unsound at the time and that sd. said
negroe negro with said complaint also that the said plaintiff purchaced purchased her as unsound propperty property and willfully practiced a fraud by vending the same. It is adjudged by the Court that the plaintiff recover of the defendant only nineteen dollars and forty four and a half cents, for his debt, and cost of suit in his behalf expended
The court find for the defendant.
The court ajourned adjourned to tomorrow morning at ten o,clock.
